edu.snu.rixk.controller

Class GetArmiesController

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.snu.rixk.controller.GetArmiesController

  • public class GetArmiesController
extends java.lang.Object
    GetArmiesController This Controller handles the events that happen during the GetArmies phase of playing Rixk.
    Version:
    $Revision$ ($Author$)
    Author:
    Tim Solum

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GetArmiesController(GameState model, GetArmiesView view)
      Builds this SetupController object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void getPlayerArmiesEvent()
      This event signals that the active Player should receive armies based on their bonuses.
      void placeArmiesEvent()
      This event triggers the acting Player to begin placing armies.
      void startAttackEvent(AttackView attackView)
      This event signals the GameViewManager that the GetArmiesView will be done soon and it queues up the AttackView that should follow.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • GetArmiesController

        public GetArmiesController(GameState model,
                           GetArmiesView view)
        Builds this SetupController object.
        Parameters:
        model - The GameState object for the game
        view - The GetArmiesView this Controller operates on

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayerArmiesEvent

        public void getPlayerArmiesEvent()
        This event signals that the active Player should receive armies based on their bonuses.

      • placeArmiesEvent

        public void placeArmiesEvent()
        This event triggers the acting Player to begin placing armies.

      • startAttackEvent

        public void startAttackEvent(AttackView attackView)
        This event signals the GameViewManager that the GetArmiesView will be done soon and it queues up the AttackView that should follow.
        Parameters:
        attackView - The AttackView that comes next
